hints.label: def-representation-space
hints.title: Fragile Gas Representation Space
hints.content:
2229: :label: def-representation-space
2230: 
2231: The **representation space** $\mathfrak{R}$ is the collection of all mathematical structures encoding Fragile Gas dynamics:
2232: 
2233: $$
2234: \mathfrak{R} := \{\mathcal{R}_{\text{swarm}}, \mathcal{R}_{\text{Fractal}}, \mathcal{R}_{\text{scutoid}}, \mathcal{R}_{\text{lattice}}, \mathcal{R}_{\text{mean-field}}\}
2235: $$
2236: 
2237: **Each representation** $\mathcal{R} \in \mathfrak{R}$ consists of:
2238: 1. **State space** $\Omega_{\mathcal{R}}$: Set of all possible configurations
2239: 2. **Dynamics** $\Psi_{\mathcal{R}}: \Omega_{\mathcal{R}} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}}$: Evolution operator (possibly stochastic)
2240: 3. **Observable algebra** $\mathcal{A}_{\mathcal{R}}$: Set of measurable functions on $\Omega_{\mathcal{R}}$
2241: 4. **Information structure** $\mathcal{I}_{\mathcal{R}}$: Graph or geometric structure encoding correlations
2242: 
2243: **Projection maps** between representations:
2244: 
2245: $$
2246: \pi_{\mathcal{R} \to \mathcal{R}'}: \Omega_{\mathcal{R}} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}'}
2247: $$

hints.label: def-swarm-epsilon-machine
hints.title: Swarm ε-Machine
hints.content:
2270: :label: def-swarm-epsilon-machine
2271: 
2272: **State space:** $\Omega_{\text{swarm}} = \mathcal{X}^N \times \mathbb{R}^{Nd}$
2273: 
2274: **Past:** Trajectory history $H_k^{\text{swarm}} = \{(X_0, V_0), \ldots, (X_k, V_k)\}$
2275: 
2276: **Future:** Future trajectories $F_k^{\text{swarm}} = \{(X_{k+1}, V_{k+1}), (X_{k+2}, V_{k+2}), \ldots\}$
2277: 
2278: **Causal states:** Two pasts $H, H'$ are in the same causal state $\sigma \in \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{swarm}}$ if:
2279: 
2280: $$
2281: P(F_k^{\text{swarm}} \mid H) = P(F_k^{\text{swarm}} \mid H')
2282: $$
2283: 
2284: **ε-Machine:** Markov chain on $\Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{swarm}}$ with transitions:
2285: 
2286: $$
2287: P(\sigma' \mid \sigma, x_{k+1}, v_{k+1}) = \frac{\sum_{H \in \sigma} P(x_{k+1}, v_{k+1} \mid H) \cdot P(H)}{\sum_{H \in \sigma} P(H)}
2288: $$
2289: 
2290: **Statistical complexity:**
2291: 
2292: $$
2293: C_\mu^{\text{swarm}} := H(\Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{swarm}}) = -\sum_{\sigma \in \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{swarm}}} P(\sigma) \log P(\sigma)
2294: $$

hints.label: def-fractal-epsilon-machine-review
hints.title: Fractal Set ε-Machine (Review from §3.2)
hints.content:
2306: :label: def-fractal-epsilon-machine-review
2307: 
2308: **State space:** $\Omega_{\text{Fractal}} = \text{Episodes} \times \text{IG adjacency}$
2309: 
2310: **Past:** $H_{\text{Fractal}}(e) = \{e_0 \to e_1 \to \cdots \to e_n = e\}$ (genealogy on CST) + IG neighborhood at each time
2311: 
2312: **Future:** Descendant paths in CST + future IG evolutions
2313: 
2314: **Causal states:** Two episodes $e, e'$ are in the same causal state if:
2315: 
2316: $$
2317: P(F_{\text{CST}}(e), F_{\text{IG}}(e) \mid H_{\text{full}}(e)) = P(F_{\text{CST}}(e'), F_{\text{IG}}(e') \mid H_{\text{full}}(e'))
2318: $$
2319: 
2320: **Key distinction from swarm:** The Fractal Set ε-machine uses **episodic genealogy** (parent-child relations in CST) rather than continuous trajectories. This encodes *cloning events* explicitly as branching nodes.
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: def-scutoid-epsilon-machine
hints.title: Scutoid ε-Machine
hints.content:
2338: :label: def-scutoid-epsilon-machine
2339: 
2340: **State space:** $\Omega_{\text{scutoid}} = \{\text{Scutoid tessellations of } \mathcal{X} \times [0,T]\}$
2341: 
2342: **Configuration:** $Z_{\text{scutoid}} = \{\mathcal{S}_i(t)\}_{i=1}^N$, where each $\mathcal{S}_i(t)$ is a 4D scutoid cell
2343: 
2344: **Past:** Scutoid history $H_k^{\text{scutoid}} = \{Z_{\text{scutoid}}(0), \ldots, Z_{\text{scutoid}}(k)\}$
2345: 
2346: **Causal states:** Two scutoid histories are equivalent if they induce the same conditional distribution over future scutoid tessellations
2347: 
2348: **Key observables:**
2349: - Scutoid fraction: $\phi(t) = \frac{1}{N}\sum_i \mathbb{1}[\text{scutoid}]_i$
2350: - Mean Gaussian curvature: $\bar{K}(t) = \frac{1}{N}\sum_i K_{\Sigma}^i$
2351: - Topological charge: $\chi_{\text{tot}}(t) = \sum_i \chi_{\text{scutoid}}^i$

hints.label: thm-scutoid-fractal-equivalence
hints.title: Scutoid and Fractal Set ε-Machines have Equal Statistical Complexity
hints.content:
2359: :label: thm-scutoid-fractal-equivalence
2360: 
2361: Under the scutoid construction map $\pi_{\text{Fractal} \to \text{scutoid}}$ (Definition {prf:ref}`def-scutoid-construction` in [14_scutoid_geometry_framework.md](14_scutoid_geometry_framework.md)):
2362: 
2363: $$
2364: C_\mu^{\text{scutoid}} = C_\mu^{\text{Fractal}}
2365: $$
2366: 
2367: **Proof:**
2368: 
2369: 1. **Lossless state encoding:** The scutoid tessellation provides a **lossless geometric encoding** of the Fractal Set state space (Reconstruction Theorem 4.1 in [01_fractal_set.md](01_fractal_set.md)). All walker trajectories, cloning events, and correlations can be uniquely reconstructed from scutoid geometry:
2370:    - CST edges: Scutoid vertical boundaries encode temporal evolution
2371:    - IG edges: Scutoid horizontal adjacencies encode spatial coupling
2372: 
2373: 2. **Entropy preservation:** Since the map $\pi_{\text{Fractal} \to \text{scutoid}}$ is bijective on the state space $\Omega_{\text{Fractal}} \cong \Omega_{\text{scutoid}}$, the joint entropy of configurations is preserved:
2374: 
2375:    $$
2376:    H(\Omega_{\text{scutoid}}) = H(\Omega_{\text{Fractal}})
2377:    $$
2378: 
2379: 3. **Statistical complexity equality:** By Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-causal-state-entropy-edges`, the statistical complexity equals the process entropy. Since the process entropy is preserved by lossless encoding:
2380: 
2381:    $$
2382:    C_\mu^{\text{scutoid}} = H(\Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{scutoid}}) = H(\Omega_{\text{scutoid}}) = H(\Omega_{\text{Fractal}}) = H(\Sigma_\varepsilon^{\text{Fractal}}) = C_\mu^{\text{Fractal}}
2383:    $$
hints.raw_directive:

All walker trajectories, cloning events, and correlations can be uniquely reconstructed from scutoid geometry:

hints.label: def-lattice-epsilon-machine
hints.title: Lattice QFT ε-Machine
hints.content:
2405: :label: def-lattice-epsilon-machine
2406: 
2407: **State space:** $\Omega_{\text{lattice}} = \mathbb{R}^{|V|}$ where $V$ is the set of lattice sites
2408: 
2409: **Field configuration:** $\phi := (\phi_{n})_{n \in V}$ with $\phi_n \in \mathbb{R}$ (scalar field)
2410: 
2411: **Dynamics:** Wilson action evolution (Eq. 9.4.1 in [08_lattice_qft_framework.md](08_lattice_qft_framework.md)):
2412: 
2413: $$
2414: S[\phi] = \sum_{\langle n, m \rangle} \frac{1}{2}(\phi_n - \phi_m)^2 + \sum_n V(\phi_n)
2415: $$
2416: 
2417: **Past:** Field configuration history $H_k^{\text{lattice}} = \{\phi^{(0)}, \ldots, \phi^{(k)}\}$
2418: 
2419: **Causal states:** Two field histories are equivalent if they predict the same distribution over future field configurations
2420: 
2421: **Statistical complexity:** $C_\mu^{\text{lattice}}$ measures the entropy of gauge-invariant field configurations

hints.label: thm-lattice-scutoid-coarse-graining
hints.title: Lattice QFT ε-Machine as Coarse-Grained Scutoid ε-Machine
hints.content:
2429: :label: thm-lattice-scutoid-coarse-graining
2430: 
2431: Under the projection $\pi_{\text{scutoid} \to \text{lattice}}$ that maps scutoid centers-of-mass to lattice sites:
2432: 
2433: $$
2434: C_\mu^{\text{lattice}} \le C_\mu^{\text{scutoid}}
2435: $$
2436: 
2437: with equality if and only if **computational closure** holds:
2438: 
2439: $$
2440: P(\text{future lattice configs} \mid \text{lattice past}) = P(\text{future lattice configs} \mid \text{scutoid past projected to lattice})
2441: $$

hints.label: def-mean-field-epsilon-machine
hints.title: Mean-Field ε-Machine
hints.content:
2449: :label: def-mean-field-epsilon-machine
2450: 
2451: **State space:** $\Omega_{\text{MF}} = \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d)$, the space of probability measures on phase space
2452: 
2453: **Mean-field measure:** $\mu_t \in \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d)$ satisfying the McKean-Vlasov PDE (Theorem 5.1 in [05_mean_field.md](../05_mean_field.md))
2454: 
2455: **Dynamics:** Nonlinear Fokker-Planck equation:
2456: 
2457: $$
2458: \partial_t \mu_t = -\nabla_x \cdot (v \mu_t) + \nabla_v \cdot \left[ \left(\gamma v - F[\mu_t] \right) \mu_t \right] + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_v \mu_t
2459: $$
2460: 
2461: where $F[\mu_t] = -\nabla U + \epsilon_F \nabla V[\mu_t]$ is the self-consistent force field.
2462: 
2463: **Past:** Measure trajectory history $H_k^{\text{MF}} = \{\mu_0, \ldots, \mu_k\}$
2464: 
2465: **Causal states:** Two measure histories are equivalent if they predict the same distribution over future measures
2466: 
2467: **Statistical complexity:** $C_\mu^{\text{MF}}$ is the entropy of the measure flow on Wasserstein space
hints.raw_directive:

hints.content:
2475: :label: thm-mean-field-limit-epsilon-machine

hints.label: def-representation-equivalence
hints.title: Representation Equivalence
hints.content:
2495: :label: def-representation-equivalence
2496: 
2497: Two representations $\mathcal{R}, \mathcal{R}' \in \mathfrak{R}$ are **informationally equivalent** if there exist projections $\pi: \Omega_{\mathcal{R}} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}'}$ and $\pi': \Omega_{\mathcal{R}'} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}}$ such that:
2498: 
2499: $$
2500: C_\mu^{\mathcal{R}} = C_\mu^{\mathcal{R}'} \quad \text{and} \quad \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\mathcal{R}} \cong \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\mathcal{R}'}
2501: $$
2502: 
2503: In this case, the ε-machines are **isomorphic**: causal states are in bijection, and transition probabilities are preserved.
hints.raw_directive:
2492: ### 11.4. Representation Equivalence and Information Functors
2493: 
2494: :::{prf:definition} Representation Equivalence
2495: :label: def-representation-equivalence
2496: 
2497: Two representations $\mathcal{R}, \mathcal{R}' \in \mathfrak{R}$ are **informationally equivalent** if there exist projections $\pi: \Omega_{\mathcal{R}} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}'}$ and $\pi': \Omega_{\mathcal{R}'} \to \Omega_{\mathcal{R}}$ such that:
2498: 
2499: $$
2500: C_\mu^{\mathcal{R}} = C_\mu^{\mathcal{R}'} \quad \text{and} \quad \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\mathcal{R}} \cong \Sigma_\varepsilon^{\mathcal{R}'}
2501: $$
2502: 
2503: In this case, the ε-machines are **isomorphic**: causal states are in bijection, and transition probabilities are preserved.
2504:
